LHpqBh51SmiHfWDi.name: Discordant Screech
LHpqBh51SmiHfWDi.description: As a bonus action, you can spend a warlock spell point to make an ear-rending note with a musical instrument you are proficient with that jangles the nerves of all who hear it. Creatures in a 30 foot cone originating from you who are not deafened must make a Constitution save against your bard spell save DC. On a failure, an affected creature takes 3d4 points of psychic damage and is rattled and poisoned until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on its save takes half damage and is not poisoned.

system.description:
Your pact and your musicianship have intertwined. You gain the following benefits:

  • Your Charisma score increases by 1, to a maximum of 20.
  • You gain an additional benefit based on your pact boon:
    • If you have @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.6co2rqjh9npjg3eb]{Pact of the Blade}, you can also perform a one-hour ritual over a musical instrument you are proficient with, which you can then summon in the same manner as your pact weapon. You can only have one such musical instrument at a time. You automatically gain the benefits of @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.ttee3cjugnnohcyn]{Art Specialty} with the chosen instrument, even if it is not one you had previously selected for Art Specialty.
    • If you have @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.f2mfiz8spijbzs6h]{Pact of the Chain}, your familiar can help in your Performance checks, dancing in time to the music or providing harmonizing vocals or a supporting beat. While it is assisting you in this way, treat a d20 roll of 9 or lower on Performance checks as a 10.
    • If you have @UUID[Compendium.a5e.a5e-class-features.Item.2dp9b4a11fuxjwbc]{Pact of the Tome}, use your full bard + warlock level (rather than bard + half your warlock level) when determining your number of battle hymns and which ones you can select.
  • You gain the following feature:

    Discordant Screech

    As a bonus action, you can spend a warlock spell point to make an ear-rending note with a musical instrument you are proficient with that jangles the nerves of all who hear it. Creatures in a 30 foot cone originating from you who are not deafened must make a Constitution save against your bard spell save DC. On a failure, an affected creature takes 3d4 points of psychic damage and is rattled and poisoned until the end of its next turn. A creature that succeeds on its save takes half damage and is not poisoned.
